page.title: 11Tam O'Shanter Museum.
page.content: Ayr is the centre of the{Burns' country and in the centre of Ayr is the{Tam O'Shanter Museum. }It was originally a dwelling house, then an inn. It was during this period that the Burns connection was fostered. There is no proof Burns frequented this inn but as the sole remaining {18th century}building in Ayr it was purchased by the Burns Club with the intention of commemorating the poet. Since its opening in 1957 many items with a Burns connection have been donated and each year about 8000 people visit. It is from here the Burns' Ride begins the journey to Brig O'Doon. The ride is a re_enactment of the poem and an important event in {Burns' Festival Week}each June. Plans by the District Council to make structural changes and license the premises are being opposed.
